critique: The document is a letter from the President to the Secretary of War regarding the prevention of unlawful expeditions. The tone is formal and official. There is no explicit expression of joy, sadness, anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. The letter conveys a sense of duty and authority. The initial scores are all 1, as there is no strong indication of any particular emotion. After further consideration, the letter does not evoke any strong emotions. Therefore, the revised scores remain the same.
